definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The turning point of the Ming Dynasty from prosperity to decline was the reign of Emperor Shenzong.
sentences.chinese: 明朝由盛到衰的转折点是明神宗的统治。

sentences.english: Stocks are slightly lower as investors weigh up the chances of whether this is a major turning point.
sentences.chinese: 投资者考量这是一个重要转折点的几率，股市小跌。

sentences.english: The turning point in Saudi policy came in the spring of 2002.
sentences.chinese: 沙特阿拉伯政策的转折点是2002年春天。

sentences.english: Valley Forge was a turning point in the American Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 弗吉谷是美国革命史上的转折点。

sentences.english: The results show saddle-node bifurcation arises in the turning point of amplitude-frequency curve.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果表明幅频曲线转折点出现鞍结分叉。

sentences.english: Revolution of the Xinhai Year was the turning point to the national industry in Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命对浙江的民族工业来说是一个重要的转折点。

sentences.english: “This was a very important turning point for China’s economy, ” he says.
sentences.chinese: 吴说，“这份报告是中国经济的一个重要转折点”。

sentences.english: Was that something of a watershed for Spanish football?
sentences.chinese: 可以认为那是西班牙足球的转折点吗？

sentences.english: "Close to a tipping point the system becomes more inert, " Scheffer said.
sentences.chinese: 系统接近转折点时，会变得更加迟钝。

sentences.english: But eventually, the economy would reach a turning-point.
sentences.chinese: 但是最后，经济会到达一个转折点。

sentences.english: This is a major turning point.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个重大的转折点。

sentences.english: It was also the turning point for the Irish Brigade.
sentences.chinese: 同样地，这也是爱尔兰旅的转折点。

sentences.english: It is one of the biggest turnarounds in history.
sentences.chinese: 这可以说是历史上最大的转折点之一。

sentences.english: The international experience indicates that China starts to experience the Lewisian Turing Point.
sentences.chinese: 国际经验表明我国开始进入刘易斯转折点。

sentences.english: The Islamic Revolution serves as the turning point in America's nuclear policy toward Iran.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰革命成为美国伊核政策的转折点。

sentences.english: We also find that the turning points in these inverted U-shaped relationships vary for different pollutants.
sentences.chinese: 并且证实不同的环境质量指标对应于不同的转折点。

definition: turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
miniature version of sth/microcosm/epitome/(Tw) to microfilm
direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
